title: Jax can dodge AA based CC's on PBE
body:
Yea, after the patch he can dodge all the damage and CC of Udyr E, Renekton W, Leona Stun, and other auto based CC's, this was never the case before, he took the CC and some of the damage in some cases (like renekton's), but now he dodges everything

Why wasn't this documented in the patch notes? I understand this was an intended goal of Riot to fix dodge/block this preseason but shouldn't something like this have been noted?

replies.body: I really like that update. I've been using jax a lot lately to climb up the silver ranks (silver 3 right now :D ) and one thing that really ticks me off is when I'm hitting my E and still being hit by auto attacks that have some form of a component added to them..

It's a good change 

But you think they'd mention something this big

It's a change that will be in the patch notes for 5.22. We haven't released any official notes yet and it's not the sort of change that's easily picked up by data mining PBE builds.

This change also applies to Blinds, so Teemo will be able to negate CCs with Blinding Dart (though the timing on that's much harder than on Counterstrike of course). Similarly Panth's block also stops effects attached to the auto attack blocked. Additionally various attacks that previously hit through blind/dodge/block will now be negated as you'd expect. There are a couple of exceptions however, in cases where an ability that's more spell than auto attack (as opposed to auto attack with added effect) uses right click as a means of triggering (Volibear Q and Hecarim E being the only two from memory).

Did you know if blitz grabs a tristana while she rocket jumps she will still jump away.

Same with Ezreal, and it has been stated many times that it's intentional. Those dashes have a delay before they activate, so as a "tradeoff" for taking some damage they would have avoided had it activated instantly they get to move while CC'd if they time it right.

The reverse is also true. If Tristana starts casting rocket jump, then gets hit by rocket grab, then finishes casting rocket jump, she jumps away. It's intended. 
Jumps/knock-ups/knock-backs/pulls override eachother. The last one to 'activate' is the one that gets finished.
